comments:
This with build I20030422.

I'm not sure how I did this as I have not been able to reproduce it but the 
steps may have been something like:
- have Java perspective visible
- change the Outline view to a fast view
- do some other stuff (may even have shutdown and restarted Eclipse)
- right click on the Outline fast view icon (in the shortcut bar on the left 
side of the workbench window)
- select 'Fast View' which had a check mark beside it so that the outline view 
should reappear (but it didn't in this case)
- shutdown Eclipse
- I'm not sure if the NPE occurred when the Outline view failed to reappear in 
the Java perspective or on shutdown

NPE in the .log file appeared as:

!SESSION Apr 29, 2003 14:19:37.241 --------------------------------------------
-
java.version=1.4.1_02
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -data 
d:/I20030422data/eclipse/plugins -install file:D:/I20030422/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Apr 29, 2003 14:19:37.257
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Apr 29, 2003 14:19:37.257
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:840)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:1933)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:1640)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1402)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:1385)

(InternalBootLoader.java:845)

(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)

(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)

	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:747)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:583)

It can be reproduced using the following steps:
- start eclipse with a new workspace
- close welcome editor
- open java perspective
- d&d outline view to shortcut bar (so it becomes a fast view)
- create a java project, package, then java class
- close java editor
- exit eclipse
- restart eclipse
- open context menu on outline fast view icon in shortcut bar
- uncheck "fast view"
==> exception

Fixed the code of Perspective.restoreState - it was not creating the ViewPane 
for fast views, only for regular views. Confirmed by Eduardo.
